thread.title: Dartmouth Fall Annual Town Meeting starts 7 pm at the high school
thread.title_full: Dartmouth Fall Annual Town Meeting starts 7 pm at the high school

author: Auditi Guha aguha@s-t.com
title: Dartmouth Fall Annual Town Meeting starts 7 pm at the high school
text: Dartmouth Fall Annual Town Meeting starts 7 pm at the high school Comment Posted Oct. 19, 2015 at 7:36 PM Updated at 9:39 PM Posted Oct. 19, 2015 at 7:36 PM Updated at 9:39 PM » Social News DARTMOUTH — Town Meeting will weigh in on a 20-article warrant at 7 p.m. Tuesday in the Dartmouth High School auditorium, 555 Bakerville Road. Approving the cost of r ehabilitating the closed police station, funding capital improvements and boosting the open space reserve fund are among the items members will consider. The town wants to borrow $8.4 million to rehabilitate and renovate the closed police station at 249 Russells Mills Road, as recommended by the police building committee. In other items, the town is looking to make energy efficiency improvements, replace election machines, partially replace the middle school roof and make technology upgrades in schools. T he Community Preservation Committee is looking to transfer $290,511 to the Open Space Reserve Fund; $140,342 is needed to fund the police union collective bargaining agreement; a deputy harbormaster position may be created; and officials want to file a home rule petition for an additional wine and beer license . There are 320 registered Town Meeting members and a quorum of 161 is needed, said Town Clerk Lynn Medeiros. She said she expects the meeting to move quickly but the length of time will depend on how much discussion articles generate. A link to the warrant is available on the town's homepage at http://town.dartmouth.ma.us . By Auditi Guha
